Filters.name: Class
Filters.description: A class in programming languages serves as a blueprint or template for creating objects, which are instances of that class.

Filters.name: Function
Filters.description: A function in programming is a self-contained block of code that performs a specific task.

Filters.name: Variable
Filters.description: A variable in programming is a named storage location used to hold data that can change during the execution of a program.

Filters.name: Conditional
Filters.description: A conditional in programming is a statement that allows the execution of certain code blocks based on specific conditions.

class.description: A Class is a fundamental concept in object-oriented programming (OOP). It serves as a blueprint or template for creating objects. A class encapsulates data for the object (attributes or properties) and functions (methods) that operate on the data.

function.description: A function is a self-contained block of code that performs a specific task.

variable.description: A variable is a named storage location used to hold data that can change during the execution of a program.
